title: How Many Calories Are in 6 Strawberries?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in 6 strawberries, including carbs, fiber, sugars, protein, and fat details on a per-strawberry basis with quick tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories Are in 6 Strawberries?
assumptions: Fresh, medium-sized strawberries (about 15 g each), whole, ripe, no added sugar or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, variety, ripeness, and growing conditions. Check labels for packaged berries when available.

quick_answer.text: Six medium strawberries offer about 24 calories, mostly from natural sugars and carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Dipped in 1 tsp chocolate per strawberry
Topped with 1 tsp sugar per strawberry
Blended into a smoothie with yogurt (add 50 g yogurt for all 6)

faqs.q: How many calories in one strawberry?
faqs.a: About 4 calories for one medium fresh strawberry.
Yes, 6 strawberries have only 5.4 g carbs, with 1.2 g fiber.

faqs.q: Do strawberries have any protein or fat?
faqs.a: Minimal—0.6 g protein and 0 g fat in 6 strawberries.

faqs.q: How do strawberries compare calorie-wise to other berries?
faqs.a: Similar to raspberries (low ~30 kcal per cup); lower than bananas but higher than blackberries per piece.

faqs.q: Does strawberry size affect calorie count?
faqs.a: Yes—larger ones (20 g) add ~2-3 more kcal each; smaller ones less.
